bug.short_desc: Add support for static arguments in qx.core.Timer.once

long_desc.thetext:
The native setTimeout/setInterval methods support static arguments which are given when initializing the timeout/interval e.g.
setTimeout(function() {}, 100, arg1, arg2);
This should also be supported by qx.core.Timer.once as it omits the usage of additional binds which are otherwise necessary.
Not sure if this makes sense for the class itself, using the "interval" event, too.
See also: https://developer.mozilla.org/Talk:en/DOM/window.setTimeout

I don't like to change the API of qx.event.Timer.once() even if it is a compatible change. All places, where qooxdoo accepts callback only support a function and a context. In this spirit "once" is consitent with the rest of qooxdoo. On the other hand, I don't think this is a very common usecase. In the whole qooxdoo code base there isn't a single use of qx.event.Timer.once(), where this feature would be needed. If application code needs to bind additional parameters "qx.lang.Function.bind()" should be used.
